result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey Cliffton Howard

records.addlTxt:
2:25 PM Defendant Corey Cliffton Howard in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

Defendant appears without an attorney at this time.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint, is handed one by the State.
Court gives the Defendant a minute to read over the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

Defendant went to the public defender's office, one has not been found yet.

Matter will be adjourned.

Court advises Defendant to contact the public defender's office, to keep checking.
Court appreciate Defendant's diligence.

BY THE COURT: Bond is continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial Appearance set for 10/31/22 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 1
CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by: A.L.W.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  A. L. W.  *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.

1:14 PM Defendant Corey Cliffton Howard appeared by video, in custody. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct, and Strangulation. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant   is  eligible for public defender representation.
State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
